title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-1#char=0,204
text: Founded in 1897 as Sport-Club Juventus by a group of young Torinese students, among them, who was their first president, Eugenio Canfari, and his brother Enrico, author of the company's historical memory.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-10#char=0,160
text: He graduated from high school at 16, then moved to the University of Turin. Despite a strong interest for mathematics and physics, he decided to study medicine.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-11#char=0,193
text: Dulbecco was the recipient of the Selman A. Waksman Award in Microbiology from the National Academy of Sciences in 1974. He was elected a Foreign Member of the Royal Society (ForMemRS) in 1974.

labels.name: Selman A. Waksman Award in Microbiology

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-12#char=0,321
text: With the help of physicist Enrico Fermi, whom he knew from his time at the University of Rome, Luria received a Rockefeller Foundation fellowship at Columbia University. He soon met Delbrück and Hershey, and they collaborated on experiments at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory and in Delbrück's lab at Vanderbilt University.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-13#char=0,238
text: From 1943 to 1950, he worked at Indiana University. His first graduate student was James D. Watson, who went on to discover the structure of DNA with Francis Crick. In January 1947, Luria became a naturalized citizen of the United States.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-14#char=0,240
text: A president is the leader of a country or a division or part of a country, typically a republic, a democracy, or a dictatorship. The title "president" is sometimes used by extension for leaders of other groups, including corporate entities.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-15#char=0,206
text: Etymologically, a president is one who presides. Originally, the term referred to the presiding officer of a ceremony or meeting (i.e., chairman), but today it most commonly refers to an executive official.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-16#char=0,185
text: Among other things, "President" today is a common title for the heads of state of most republics, whether presidential republics, semi-presidential republics or parliamentary republics.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-17#char=0,188
text: Its website was launched on February 4, 2004 by Mark Zuckerberg with his Harvard College roommates and fellow students Eduardo Saverin, Andrew McCollum, Dustin Moskovitz, and Chris Hughes.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-18#char=0,193
text: Those people, called founders, had initially limited the website's membership to Harvard students, but later expanded it to colleges in the Boston area, the Ivy League, and Stanford University.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-19#char=0,161
text: Professorships in Italy were granted by competition (concorso) for a vacant chair, the applicants being rated on their publications by a committee of professors.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-2#char=0,192
text: They have been managed by the industrial Agnelli family since 1923, which constitutes the oldest sporting partnership in Italy, thus making Juventus the first professional club in the country.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-20#char=0,151
text: Fermi applied for a chair of mathematical physics at the University of Cagliari on Sardinia, but was narrowly passed over in favour of Giovanni Giorgi.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-21#char=0,93
text: In 1926, at the age of 24, he applied for a professorship at the Sapienza University of Rome.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-22#char=0,321
text: This was a new chair, one of the first three in theoretical physics in Italy, that had been created by the Minister of Education at the urging of Professor Orso Mario Corbino, who was the University's professor of experimental physics, the Director of the Institute of Physics, and a member of Benito Mussolini's cabinet.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-23#char=0,158
text: Laura Capon was born in Rome in 1907. Capon met Enrico Fermi while she was a student in general science at the University of Rome. The couple married in 1928.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-24#char=0,142
text: Reagan was twice elected as President of the Screen Actors Guild, the labor union for actors, where he worked to root out Communist influence.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-25#char=0,243
text: As governor, Reagan raised taxes, turned a state budget deficit to a surplus, challenged the protesters at the University of California, ordered National Guard troops in during a period of protest movements in 1969, and was re-elected in 1970.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-26#char=0,160
text: In Italy the rector is the head of the university and Rappresentante Legale (Legal representative) of the university. He or she is elected by an electoral body.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-27#char=0,246
text: The College of William and Mary also has a "Chancellor" who acts in a ceremonial capacity. As far as American high schools, one notable case is the Rector of St. Paul's School in New Hampshire, in which the Rector is equivalent to the Headmaster.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-28#char=0,253
text: The term "rector" is uncommon in Australian academic institutions. The executive head of an Australian university has traditionally been given the British title Vice-Chancellor, although in recent times the American term President has also been adopted.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-29#char=0,251
text: The prize ceremonies take place annually in Stockholm, Sweden, except for the peace prize which is held in Oslo, Norway and each recipient, or laureate, receives a gold medal, a diploma and a sum of money that has been decided by the Nobel Foundation.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-3#char=0,163
text: Gianni Agnelli became the head of Fiat from 1966 to 2003 and made the company into the most important company in Italy and one of the major car builders of Europe.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-30#char=0,90
text: Alfred Nobel was born on 21 October 1833 in Stockholm, Sweden, into a family of engineers.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-31#char=0,154
text: James Alexander Hendler is an artificial intelligence researcher at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, USA, and one of the originators of the Semantic Web.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-32#char=0,303
text: Hendler held a longstanding position as professor at the University of Maryland where he was the Director of the Joint Institute for Knowledge Discovery and held joint appointments in the Department of Computer Science, the Institute for Advanced Computer Studies and the Institute for Systems Research.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-33#char=0,123
text: Hendler was the Director for Semantic Web and Agent Technology at the Maryland Information and Network Dynamics Laboratory.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-34#char=0,169
text: He is a Fellow of the American Association for Artificial Intelligence, the British Computer Society, the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers and the AAAS.

labels.name: Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence
Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
American Association for the Advancement of Science

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-35#char=0,313
text: Berners-Lee is the director of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), which oversees the continued development of the Web. He is also the founder of the World Wide Web Foundation, and is a senior researcher and holder of the founders chair at the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL).

labels.name: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-36#char=0,207
text: He attended Sheen Mount Primary School, and then went on to attend south west London's Emanuel School from 1969 to 1973, at the time a direct grant grammar school, which became an independent school in 1975.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-37#char=0,223
text: Berners-Lee worked as an independent contractor at CERN from June to December 1980. While in Geneva, he proposed a project based on the concept of hypertext, to facilitate sharing and updating information among researchers.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-38#char=0,349
text: Brown's time as Chancellor was marked by major reform of Britain's monetary and fiscal policy architecture, transferring interest rate setting powers to the Bank of England, by a wide extension of the powers of the Treasury to cover much domestic policy and by transferring responsibility for banking supervision to the Financial Services Authority.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-39#char=0,251
text: Brown was educated first at Kirkcaldy West Primary School where he was selected for an experimental fast stream education programme, which took him two years early to Kirkcaldy High School for an academic hothouse education taught in separate classes.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-4#char=0,219
text: Fiat has a long history in United States. In 1908, the Fiat Automobile Co. was established in the country and a plant in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., began producing Fiats a year later, like the Fiat 60 HP and the Fiat 16-20 HP.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-40#char=0,87
text: He served as Rector until 1975, and also edited the document The Red Paper on Scotland.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-41#char=0,146
text: From 1976 to 1980 Brown was employed as a lecturer in politics at Glasgow College of Technology. He also worked as a tutor for the Open University

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-42#char=0,257
text: He attended grammar school in Belfast from the age of 12 and entered the University of Glasgow in 1746 when he was eighteen years old, studying there for four years before spending another four at the University of Edinburgh, furthering his medical studies.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-43#char=0,103
text: In 1757, Black was appointed Regius Professor of the Practice of Medicine at the University of Glasgow.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-44#char=0,181
text: In 1766, treading in the footsteps of his friend and former teacher at Glasgow, Black succeeded William Cullen as Professor of Medicine and Chemistry at the University of Edinburgh.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-45#char=0,228
text: In 1755 he was enticed by Lord Kames to become Professor of Chemistry and Medicine at the University of Edinburgh. It was in Edinburgh, in 1756, that he gave the first documented public demonstration of artificial refrigeration.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-46#char=0,135
text: He was father to the judge Robert Cullen and to the physician Henry Cullen. Cullen's eldest son Robert became a Scottish judge in 1796.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-47#char=0,266
text: In October 1850, already an accomplished mathematician, Maxwell left Scotland for the University of Cambridge. He initially attended Peterhouse, but before the end of his first term transferred to Trinity, where he believed it would be easier to obtain a fellowship.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-48#char=0,94
text: In 1857 Maxwell befriended the Reverend Daniel Dewar, who was then the Principal of Marischal.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-49#char=0,72
text: In 1871 he became the first Cavendish Professor of Physics at Cambridge.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-5#char=0,242
text: Marvin Lee Minsky was born to an eye surgeon father, Henry, and to a Jewish mother, Fannie, who was an activist in Zionist affairs, in New York City, where he attended the Ethical Culture Fieldston School and the Bronx High School of Science.

labels.name: The Bronx High School of Science

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-50#char=0,129
text: Faraday was born in Newington Butts, which is now part of the London Borough of Southwark but was then a suburban part of Surrey.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-55#char=0,118
text: Along with the University of Edinburgh, the University was part of the Scottish Enlightenment during the 18th century.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-56#char=0,97
text: The University of Glasgow was founded in 1451 AD by a charter or papal bull from Pope Nicholas V.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-57#char=0,73
text: He studied at Bologna and Florence, gaining a degree in theology in 1422.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-58#char=0,83
text: After a long decline, Bologna was reborn in the 5th century under Bishop Petronius.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-59#char=0,63
text: Saint Petronius was bishop of Bologna during the fifth century.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-6#char=0,147
text: In the early 1970s, at the MIT Artificial Intelligence Lab, Minsky and Papert started developing what came to be called the Society of Mind theory.

labels.name: MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-7#char=0,268
text: Ray Kurzweil grew up in the New York City borough of Queens. He was born to secular Jewish parents who had emigrated from Austria just before the onset of World War II. He was exposed via Unitarian Universalism to a diversity of religious faiths during his upbringing.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-8#char=0,168
text: While in high school, Kurzweil had corresponded with Marvin Minsky and was invited to visit him at MIT, which he did. Kurzweil also visited Frank Rosenblatt at Cornell.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-9#char=0,222
text: He obtained a B.S. in computer science and literature in 1970 at MIT. He went to MIT to study with Marvin Minsky. He took all of the computer programming courses (eight or nine) offered at MIT in the first year and a half.
